description:
New Devilman project marking Go Nagai's 50th anniversary as a creator.

The protagonist Akira Fudou learns from his best friend, Ryou Asuka, that an ancient race of demons has returned to take back the world from humans. Ryou tells Akira that the only way to defeat the demons is to incorporate their supernatural powers, and suggests that he unite with a demon himself. Akira succeeds in transforming into Devilman, who possesses both the powers of a demon and the soul of a human. The battle of Devilman and Akira Fudou begins.

(Source: Netflix)
synonyms: デビルマン クライベイビー
เดวิลแมน ครายเบบี้

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Athletics
tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Masturbation
tags.description: Features erotic stimulation of one's own genitalia or other erogenous regions.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Hip-hop Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of hip-hop, not to be applied to anime that use hip-hop in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Public Sex
tags.description: Features sexual acts performed in public settings.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

title.native: デビルマン 誕生編

name.native: アナトリ・クラスノフ

node.description:
Kiyoshi Nagai, better known by the pen name Gou Nagai, is a Japanese manga artist and a prolific author of science fiction, fantasy, horror and erotica. He made his professional debut in 1967 with Meakashi Polikichi, but is best known for creating popular 1970s manga and anime series such as [Cutie Honey](https://anilist.co/manga/86168/Cutey-Honey/), [Devilman](https://anilist.co/manga/31474/Devilman/) and [Mazinger Z](https://anilist.co/manga/38773/Mazinger-Z/). He is credited with creating the super robot genre and for designing the first mecha robots piloted by a user from within a cockpit with Mazinger Z, and for pioneering the magical girl genre with Cutie Honey, the post-apocalyptic genre with [Violence Jack](https://anilist.co/manga/31442/Violence-Jack/), and the ecchi genre with [Harenchi Gakuen](https://anilist.co/manga/42808/Harenchi-Gakuen/). 

In 2005, he became a Character Design professor at the Osaka University of Arts. He has been a member of the Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize's nominating committee since 2009.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaakiyuasa)

An acclaimed anime director known for his wild, freeform style. 

After graduating from the Kyushu Sangyo University's Faculty of Arts in 1987 he joined studio [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/Ajiado), initially as in-betweener but rapidly moving to key animation. 

In the first part of his career Yuasa established himself as an idiosyncratic creator while working on several child friendly anime, such as [Chibi Maruko-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/951/Chibi-Marukochan/) and [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2677/Doraemon-Nobitas-Animal-Planet/), but especially on [Crayon Shin-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/966/Shin-Chan/), a project he was involved with for most of the '90s. 

One of his breakthrough roles in this period was his participation on the second part of [The Hakkenden](https://anilist.co/anime/12715/The-Hakkenden-Legend-of-the-Dog-Warriors-Part-2/), working as animation director under [Shinya Oohira](https://anilist.co/staff/103893/Shinya-Oohira)'s direction. This OVA was an important outing of the '90s, uniting many veteran artists and talented newcomers. 

He debuted as director on [Mind Game](https://anilist.co/anime/875/Mind-Game/), an abstract piece combining animation and live-action footage, winning the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival (overcoming even Hayao Miyazaki's [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/Howls-Moving-Castle/)), and earning [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/Yoshiyuki-Tomino)'s praise, who acted as the chief judge. After Mind Game Yuasa spent several years at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) working on various projects. In 2013, he founded [Science SARU](https://anilist.co/studio/6145/Science-SARU) alongside his close affiliate [Eun-Yeong Choi](https://anilist.co/staff/115088/EunYeong-Choi).

On March 25, 2020 it was announced Yuasa stepped down as the CEO of Science SARU. He would work there as director until the completion of his latest Movie, [Inu-Oh](https://anilist.co/anime/109928/InuOh/), and would later cease any affiliation with the studio.

On February 17, 2025 it was announced that Yuasa would launch of his own animation studio, ame pippin. Their debut project would be the film [Daisy's Life](https://anilist.co/anime/190574/Hinagiku-no-Jinsei/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichirou_o)

Waseda University graduate. Best known as the co-creator of [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/).

__[Website](https://www.agraph.jp/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4L0gz16xuM1as1OgYzh1SR)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/agraph)__

Kensuke Ushio, alternatively known by stage name agraph, is a Japanese musician, DJ, composer, arranger, programmer, remixer and member of rock band [Lama](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/lama/profile/).

When he was a child Kensuke learned to play the piano, while later at University he started studying arts and music, in addition to also learning how to use audio editing software like Pro Tools. At the age of 20, Kensuke first came in contact with the electronic music world known as techno. 

In 2007, he would start his solo career under the stage name agraph, this is when he started to create his own electronic music. His debut album titled A Day, Phases, produced by Takkyu Ishino, was released in December of 2008. Skipping to 2010, he would release his second album titled Equal which managed to rank in the Japanese Albums Charts.

In 2011, Kensuke and former musicians from the bands Supercar and Number Girl formed a rock band called Lama. The band has released two albums, which both managed to rank in the official Albums Charts of Japan.  It was later revealed that due to his involvement in the rock band Lama, he wouldn't be able to release a third album until 6 years after his second album. His third album titled The Shader was released in 2016.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/e8144) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eunyoung_tokyo)

Eun-Yeong Choi is an animator, director and producer. Since 2020, she is the President and CEO of the animation studio [Science SARU](https://anilist.co/studio/6145/), which she co-founded with [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/) in 2013. A frequent collaborator with Yuasa, she has been involved in all of his projects since _[Kemonozume](https://anilist.co/anime/1454/)_ (2006).

Choi began her career as an animator on shows such as _[Witchblade](https://anilist.co/anime/935/)_, _[Black Lagoon](https://anilist.co/anime/889/)_ and _Kemonozume_ (all 2006). She made her directorial debut in 2008 on episodes of _[Kaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/3701/)_, and later worked as assistant director on _[Kick-Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/16149/)_ (2013). Choi transitioned to producer in 2017, beginning with _[The Night Is Short, Walk On Girl](https://anilist.co/anime/97917/)_. In 2021, she returned to directing, helming an episode of _Star Wars: Visions_.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [writer](https://anilist.co/staff/249891) or the younger [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/283043)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/a_kurashima)

Affiliated with [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/木村絵理子)

__Genre:__ Fashion punk __[Website](https://www.ziyoou-vachi.com/index.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/qb_announce)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6whFEcaV75AmQMiwlfaxvc)__ __Introduction:__ Ziyoou-vachi, otherwise internationally known as Queen Bee (stylized as QUEEN BEE) is a Japanese four-piece band under record labels Ziyoou Record (2011-) and Sony Music Associated Records (2011-). The band first made headlines when they were chosen to play on the extremely selective "ROOKIE A GO-GO" stage at Japan's largest outdoor music festival, FUJI ROCK FESTIVAL. Singing in both low and high pitch, the extremely unique main vocal along with the band’s creative and eccentric performance made them the talk of the music scene before they were even debuted. __Biography:__ The band signed with the major record label, Sony Music Associated Records in 2011 by releasing their first debut album “Peacock.” They successfully drew attention to the music industry when their song “DESCO” was used as the theme song for “Moteki”, a highly rated movie in Japan. The band was also cast in the movie and had made their first appearance on the big screen. In 2012, the band released their 2nd album “Snake Princess.” Since then they have become active regulars at Japan’s major festivals, including repeated appearances at FUJI ROCK FESTIVAL, Summer Sonic and many more. In 2013 the band went into a brief hiatus due to the departure of the guitarist because of health issue. The band came back in 2014 and released a full new album “Kirei.” In 2016, main vocal AVU started a side project Gokumontoikka and released a smash hit split single “Kinsei/Shibou Yugi." Summer of 2016, the band performed overseas for the first time at “World Music Day” Festival in Paris. After releasing their 5th album “Q” in April 2017, the band kicked off to a sold-out national tour that included 15 shows. Later that year, the band performed in the musical production of “ROCKY HORROR SHOW (Jap ver.)” featuring AVU as one of the main cast. In 2018, QUEEN BEE released a new single “HALF” which is the theme song of the highly anticipated anime “Tokyo Ghoul：re“ that was premiered in Spring 2018. In 2019, they released a new single “Fire” which is the theme song for the anime “Dororo” (created by Osamu Tezuka) that was premiered in January 2019. In March, the band made their first appearance at one of the most famous music festival in Taiwan, “MEGAPORT FESTVIAL 2019.” It was full house despite their first performance in Taiwan. In May, the band released a brand new full album “Ten.” The lead track of the album “Holy war” is the theme song for the move “Sadako,” and “Introduction” is the theme song for the live-action movie "Tokyo Ghoul【S】." Celebrating the band’s 10 year anniversary, QUEEN BEE will be kicking off a national tour with approximately 20,000 fans. In August, main vocal AVU was cast in the Japanese Broadway Musical “HEDWIG AND THE ANGRY INCH” as Yitzhak. __Members:__ - [Avu-chan](https://anilist.co/staff/124946/Avuchan) (otherwise known under her full pseudonym as Avu Barazono) - lead vocalist (2009-) - Yashi-chan (otherwise known under the full pseudonym as Yashi Akatorii) - bass guitarist (2009-) - Ruri-chan (otherwise known under the full pseudonym as Ruri Nijigamine) - drummer (2009-2023) - Hibari-kun - lead guitarist (2015-) __Former Members:__ - Yuuki-chan - lead guitarist (2009) - Gigi-chan (otherwise known under the full pseudonym Gigi Yurijou) - lead guitarist (2009-2012) (All band members are known to use pseudonyms instead of their real names, as such not much information is known about their real identity) (Source: [Ziyoou-vachi's Official Website](https://www.ziyoou-vachi.com/about/index_e.html), edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3227731442)

**Non-anime credits:**
~!- Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth (Video Game, 2018) (OP Director, OP Character Design, OP Storyboard, OP Animation Director, OP Key Animation)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3227731442)

**Non-anime credits:**
~!- Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth (Video Game, 2018) (OP Director, OP Character Design, OP Storyboard, OP Animation Director, OP Key Animation)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3227731442)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3227731442)

**Non-anime credits:**
~!- Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth (Video Game, 2018) (OP Director, OP Character Design, OP Storyboard, OP Animation Director, OP Key Animation)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hakuoishii)

Trilingual, speaking fluent Taiwanese, Japanese and English. He graduated from Tokyo Designer College.

Initially gained recognition by directing [My Hero Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21459/My-Hero-Academia/)'s First Season action finale, where he displayed many of the characteristics he would refine later. A certain penchant for action storyboarding and climax episodes involving his acquaintances among some of the most talented digital animators in the industry.

This style was consolidated on [Fate/Apocrypha](https://anilist.co/anime/98035/FateApocrypha/)  Ep. 22 and later on [Mob Psycho II](https://anilist.co/anime/101338/Mob-Psycho-100-II/) Ep. 5.

[Website](https://www.denkigroove.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/DENKI_GROOVE_) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/denkigrooveofficial) 

Denki Groove was founded in 1989 by Takkyu Ishino and Pierre Taki, both of whom are natives of Shizuoka, Shizuoka Prefecture.

The group's major-label debut studio album, Flash Papa, was released in 1991. Subsequently, the group released a number of albums such as U.F.O. (1991), Karateka (1992), Vitamin (1993), Dragon (1994), Orange (1996), A (1997), and Voxxx (2000). The group's 1997 single, "Shangri-La", has sold more than half a million copies. The group took a hiatus between 2001 and 2004.

In 2019, Pierre Taki was arrested on suspicion of cocaine possession. In response, Sony Music Entertainment Japan took Denki Groove's recordings off the shelves and stopped streaming the group's music. Streaming services were resumed on June 19 2020.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Yoshida graduated from Osaka Designers' College, where he studied under [Moriyasu Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/106638/) and joined his studio [Anime R](https://anilist.co/studio/971/Anime-R) thereafter. He also acts as a lecturer at Amusement Media Academy and is a member of the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA).
Highly praised by [Masayuki Miyaji](https://anilist.co/staff/102156/) during the production of [Bounen no Xamdou](https://anilist.co/anime/4177/).

title.native: 新世紀エヴァンゲリオン
寄生獣 セイの格率
新世紀エヴァンゲリオン劇場版 Air/まごころを、君に
ベルセルク 黄金時代篇Ⅲ 降臨
ベルセルク 黄金時代篇Ⅰ 覇王の卵
